Example of merging PR 1221:

Cool! Also nice you put the screenshot to show it in action.

LGTM

Cheers,
Wilder
@remibergsma possible someone added this historically and nobody cared but now. I can check this later and get back to you.
Ping @wilderrodrigues
Nice! LGTM :+1:
LGTM based on the code. It does implement a use case that should be tested. not sure if we need it in this PR
LGTM, this is why we want to be merging code instead of rebasing, no more commits on master! only merges!
LGTM, thanks for testing @remibergsma. I am going to trust on sight and as this as it is a port from the custom leaseweb code in 4.2.1.
lgtm, doing a test build, now. (not so lgtm @SudharmaJain please see my remark about imports)

Go for it, @remibergsma! Changes LGTM :+1: 

@DaanHoogland: should we wait for the outcome of your build?

Cheers,
Wilder

code LGTM and @remibergsma his test succeed, as this is in 4.5 I think it must go in 4.6 as well, however it contains way to little tests and can not be guaranteed to continue working. @bhaisaab please consider continued maintenance by automation, i.e. both unit - and integration tests.

merging
Nice find @DaanHoogland Can you please fix this @SudharmaJain ? Thanks!

Nice one, @borisroman !

LGTM :+1: 

Waiting for the test results. :)
@milamberspace Dutch complemented
40G sounds like an old fs limit. doesn't make sense nowadays.

Ping @remibergsma @DaanHoogland @borisroman 

Could you guys test it before the RC? I just fixed, but have to go to a concert now.

Hi @dmytro-shevchenko

Thanks for implementing the removal code. Could you squash the commits and add a descriptive commit message?

Thanks for the quick fix @wilderrodrigues. 

Bit explanation: redundant routers worked fine in our 4.7 cloud, then all of a sudden were broken. Root cause was due to `virtual_router_id` was set to vpc_id. When we got more than 255 it broke, as this `keepalived` setting can only be 0-255. This keeps the default in the template, which is in `keepalived.conf.templ`:

```
    virtual_router_id 51
```

Thanks @fborn for discovering the issue!

You can read the following from man keepalived.conf:

```
# arbitary unique number 0..255
# used to differentiate multiple instances of vrrpd
# running on the same NIC (and hence same socket).
virtual_router_id 51
```

Since we run only one pair of keepalived on each nic, this default is fine.

@DaanHoogland @wilderrodrigues 
assume there are two routers now routerA (master) and routerB (backup).
if  we destroy routerA (master) at first, then routerB will become master without downtime. and another routerC will create as BACKUP. However, we need to destroy routerB as well, then routerC will become MASTER and another new routerD will become BACKUP.

in this processing, we also need to wait some seconds for keepalived/conntrackd on routerC to be up , because we should make sure that the services on BACKUP are running before destroying MASTER.

hence, I think the solution in PR is good (there is only one BACKUP->MASTER state change).

for the sleep or not, we need to test it. I added it because the test failedout in my testing (without sleep).
